description: Certificate of lawfulness for proposed use of existing outbuilding to rear as an office for business administration purposes.
decision_conditions: The proposed use would be within the provisions of  the Class C3 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 (as amended) and no material change of use would have taken place from the current lawful use within Class C3(a) of that Order.

Planning permission will not be required for a use of the nature described as part of the information submitted with this application operating from this address. For avoidance of doubt the applicant is advised that this certificate pertains to the following:
- An existing outbuilding within the curtilage of the dwelling house is to be used to take calls and emails in relation to the business and only operated by the applicant only.
- No people will be calling at the dwelling in relation to the business.
- No cars would be parked or waiting near the dwelling in relation to the business.
- No signs would be displayed at the site in relation to the business.
- The property's main function will remain as a single family dwelling hou
